lexUnit.name: tie.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strip of material worn around the neck beneath a collar, tied in a knot at the front. [Clothing]

sentence.text: She had bought a silk tie for Moran , blouses and deep plum-coloured sweaters for the girls , a pair of white football boots for Michael .
Although I would have been surprised if London 's Charles Dickens Society required its members to put on a white tie for its annual dinner , the invitation card demanded it for the Scott dinner .
As do evening ties in black velvet .
He was in shirt sleeves but still looked dressed in his dark tie , trousers and waistcoat .
Attired once more in our black ties , we swung the night away .
Drainpipe trousers and fluorescent socks , drape jacket , bootlace tie and hair carefully greased back into a DA style -- the Teddy Boy certainly livened up the Fifties .
Abberley in white shirt , city tie , black trousers .
He has a gravitas that has not just been put on like a flashy waistcoat , nor indeed a Garrick Club tie .
Opposite : grey/black herringbone single/breasted wool suit , blue cotton check shirt and blue knitted wool tie , all by Cerruti 1881 .
He was on his feet now , turning up his collar , pulling the tie around his neck the while he looked towards the house .
He had got the tie from round the young man 's throat .
He thought it gave him a rakish daring look , especially when he wore it at an angle with his loud checked jacket and green tie .
He sports Edwardian sideburns and wears embroidered waistcoats during the day and in the evening always a black tie . "
Like Jack Pertwee and yet utterly unlike him , Carter took off his jacket and loosened his tie .
He had loosened his tie and undone the top button of his shirt .
He was sitting on the edge of the bed , his collar loosened and the tie he had worn at dinner hanging loose about his neck .
He loosened his gold tie and then the pale cream collar of his shirt in a gesture so filled with sexual imagery that she found a disturbing warmth flowing through her insides .
Then he turned outwards , coughed , straightened his tie , and began the real business of diplomacy .
I straightened my tie and guided my hair back with my hands .
Wearing the county tie was a mark of modest social distinction and with that went the responsibility of meeting debts and subsidizing the side .
I gave up the stiff white collars that I had worn at the advertising agency and was careful to wear plain ties ; but my suits were Burton 's at £10 a time .
He was wearing a tie for the first time in his life .
Mr Wickens , 32 , whose firm owns several games shops , was wearing a dinner jacket and black tie as he left an awards dinner at a Marble Arch hotel .
It would be nice if , just for once , he did not wear a red tie .
His light summer suit and pale striped silk tie are for once exactly like the light summer suits and pale striped silk ties that everybody else is wearing .
The men with the Brigade ties and their friends were running out of potential mutual acquaintances to describe .
His tie was loose and he was in his shirt sleeves .
At their wedding , all those years ago , his friends , all of them even then in suits and ties , had nudged each other when he rose to answer his best man .
